data.title: Dutch consultants are to unite
data.meta_description:
Four organisations representing 80% of the 13 000 medical consultants in the Netherlands are to unite in the face of what they call politicians' “scant understanding” of the problems facing specialist care.

The consultants have banded together out of fear that a so called “English situation” could arise, with long waiting lists and the start of a two tier system. They claim that this will be the result of the planned restructuring of the health system. On 1 January 1997 the old system of billing health …
